result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge L. Varela Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

Arresting Agency: JEPD

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1044am [mo]
Defendant Jorge L. Varela Lopez in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Shawna Stevenoski--sworn as Spanish Interpreter

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Lopez

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges, to commence on  7/27/15 at  6:00 pm.
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Ashley Keebler except for letter of apology and for purposes that align with apartment manager/ tenant relations,  per Agent
--letter of apology to Ashley Keebler is to be reviewed and provided to Agent
--no taking photographs without approval of person being photographed
--submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/Sheriff
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 11:20am

Case called at 2:22pm [mo]
Defendant Jorge L. Varela Lopez in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Atty. Dahnert requests for a Spanish/English interpreter to be present for Mr. Varela- Lopez at future hearings. 
recess:2:25am


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on July 1, 2015 at 10:40am    (2)  Status Conference on July 14, 2015 at 10:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on June 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 3:11pm. 
Defendant Jorge L. Varela Lopez in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.; the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived. 
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Varela Lopez. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Mr. Varela Lopez indicates that he wishes to be represented by counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.  

The Court requires $1,000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Ashley Keebler
--no discussion of the case with Maria Lizet Garrido Cuevas 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 3:22pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 6/2/15 at 2:00pm
